channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: The lawyer was charged with falsifying a document as part of a deal with prosecutors conducting their own criminal inquiry of the Russia investigation, according to his lawyer.
item.title: Ex-FBI lawyer expected to plead guilty in review of Russia inquiry

item.description: Infections in Spain have surged in recent days following the end of Spain's tough lockdown seven weeks ago.
item.title: Spain bans public drinking, closes clubs as coronavirus surges

item.description: Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya called for more protests to pile pressure on the authoritarian the President as he faces the biggest challenge in his 26 years in power.
item.title: Belarus opposition leader urges new protests as pressure on Lukashenko grows

item.description: The US President is expected to visit his brother, Robert, who the White House said was "seriously ill" in hospital.
item.title: Trump's 'seriously ill' younger brother hospitalised in New York

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: Australia's economic future partly depends on a healthy skills training sector. How will it face the challenge?
item.title: Licence for change: Danish seaman at helm for TAFE's next journey

item.description: She won gold and a nation's hearts. This is how Cathy Freeman's famous suit came to be.
item.title: Tablet interactive: How the supersuit was born

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, August 15, 2020

item.dc:creator: Bianca Hall
item.description: Motorists in Melbourne's CBD and inner suburbs will escape parking fees and fines while stage four restrictions are in place.
item.title: Motorists get fees and fine freeze in Melbourne during stage four lockdown

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: After a sad week for Gary Ablett and his family, the Cats wore black armbands to honour his mother-in-law. They hope he will rejoin them but understand if he doesn't.
item.title: Cats remain respectful and patient on Ablett return

item.dc:creator: Richard Baker
item.description: The Morrison government intends to assert cabinet confidentiality over meetings of national cabinet, potentially denying Victoria's hotel quarantine inquiry of documents.
item.title: National cabinet documents might not be available to state hotel inquiry

item.dc:creator: Peter FitzSimons
item.description: As the Deputy Premier keeps pushing the interests of rugby league, a public disclosure of such an ambition would be useful – or at least a firm denial so we can exclude it.
item.title: Does John Barilaro have ambitions to run the NRL?

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Farrelly
item.description: It’s a classic modernist folly to presume that the old rules don’t apply to us. Nature disagrees.
item.title: To build COVID safe cities turn to an old rule

item.dc:creator: George Megalogenis
item.description: It has been exhausting to watch leaders buck pass this week.
item.title: Virus won't wait for our leaders to stop playing word games

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: Aboriginal Australians’ land rights have been thwarted under a recent NSW Government policy that forced them into unequal negotiations against bureaucrats for areas over which they already had legal standing.
item.title: 'Institutional racism': Aboriginal land rights impeded by NSW government

item.dc:creator: John Silvester
item.description: It is general duties police, not heavily armed specialists, who are at the greatest risk because no one knows when a routine call will flame out of control.
item.title: Born to be a cop: how New Zealand's laws failed Matthew Hunt

item.dc:creator: Tony Wright
item.description: Max Gilbert survived more than three years as a prisoner of war on the island of Ambon. Seventy-five years on, he wants Australians to know what happened there.
item.title: 'You just have to go on': talking to the last survivor of Ambon

item.dc:creator: Peter FitzSimons
item.description: August 15 should be a day for reflection and gratitude.
item.title: A rolled gold triumph for the good and great over the absolutely evil

item.dc:creator: Deborah Snow
item.description: Did the government and the aged care sector do enough to ward off the ravages wrought by coronavirus?
item.title: Aged care laid bare as true toll revealed

item.dc:creator: Nick O'Malley
item.description: Coal miners believe its use for power will bounce back with the post-pandemic economy, while climate advocates hope to see the slump kill it off entirely.
item.title: Blackballed: will coal bounce back from slump or is it terminal?

item.dc:creator: Maher Mughrabi
item.description: It is the rebuilding of Beirut that will show if the country can turn over a new leaf.
item.title: Push aside vested interests so Lebanon can be reborn

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: The police have cleared Tangara School for Girls of any health breaches as private school heads express anger that their COVID compliance was questioned
item.title: Recorders, singing and graduations off limits under new guidelines

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: On the first day of their stay at a lavish Perth golf resort, Swans rookie Chad Warner's very first swing found its way into the cup.
item.title: 'Pretty impressive': Hole-in-one omen comes true for Swans in derby delight

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: Robbie Fowler was branded "selfish" when it was announced he wasn't returning to Brisbane Roar. But he tells a different story and is taking a dispute with the club to FIFA.
item.title: 'Not a quitter': Liverpool legend Fowler claims he was unlawfully sacked by Brisbane

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: Australia's high-profile footy stars say they even receive death threats on social media due to lost bets. The wagering industry has made a big move to stop it.
item.title: 'No tolerance': Betting bans for punters who threaten top athletes

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: Sophia Kokal's procedure was called off because she lives in the same suburb as the Crossroads Hotel, which was linked to a large cluster of COVID-19 cases.
item.title: Hospital cancels procedure on Casula five-year-old over virus fears

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Saturday, August 15

item.dc:creator: Adele Ferguson
item.description: The email was more telling in what it didn’t say and where the focus lay: on protecting icare’s reputation and continuing the spin that there was nothing wrong.
item.title: 'Provocative references': Email reveals icare's Hayne moment

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: Politicians, business leaders and sports heavyweights united as never before to pull off one of the biggest coups in Australian history – to bring the Olympic juggernaut to Sydney.
item.title: How we won the Sydney Games: the inside story of diplomacy and panache

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: Residents in Brisbane's southside suburbs are angry at the increase in aircraft noise as planes fly over Brisbane suburbs and not over Moreton Bay.
item.title: 'Horrendous' new flight paths create stress in south-east Brisbane

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: The eight-month search was abandoned in May, once Cameron Dick became Treasurer, after no suitable candidates could be found.
item.title: Government blows $73,000 on recruitment, only to scrap empty position

item.dc:creator: Tim Biggs
item.description: Epic Games is taking a stand against Apple and Google's mobile payments policies, meaning for now the game is not offered on their official stores.
item.title: Fortnite maker's gamble could see mobile players shut out of the game

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Parramatta has kept its high level of office occupancy and new stock in on the way, with tenants in place.
item.title: Parramatta office market keeps ahead of CBD

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: Joe Biden’s vice-presidential announcement was a breakthrough moment in an election campaign so far drowned out by COVID-19.
item.title: 'Republicans are flummoxed': The week the US election got real

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: New research showing caffeine boosts performance suggests cyclists who stop for a coffee in the middle of their weekend ride have the right idea.
item.title: Cafe cyclists on right track: research shows caffeine boosts power

item.dc:creator: Anne Summers
item.description: The Trump campaign was devastated when Joe Biden chose Kamala Harris to be his running mate and it is floundering as to how to handle her.
item.title: Trump's worst nightmare: Kamala Harris is a repudiation of his era

item.description: The altruistic David Crowe asks why politicians cannot own up to failure.
item.title: Enough with the spin, give us transparency

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Private owners of a property at Haymarket in Sydney's new southern end of the city technology precinct are set to test the market with a price tag of more than $100 million.
item.title: Haymarket site to test the market with $100m price tag

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: The pandemic has put the focus on Australia's biotech sector where high risk, high reward is par for the course and regulators can make or break a company.
item.title: 'Not for the faint-hearted': COVID crisis brings boom time for biotechs

item.dc:creator: Melissa Singer
item.description: Months of working from home have definitely challenged what it means to be "dressed" for work. So, where does that leave the suit in life after lockdown?
item.title: Has the pandemic killed the suit for good?

item.dc:creator: Andrew Hornery
item.description: The city is in the grip of a building boom at the very pointy end of the market, where no expense is being spared.
item.title: Menulog co-founder leads Sydney's billionaire building boom

item.description: We seem to value individual contributions to such an extent that we forget not everything that makes for a good life can be achieved alone.
item.title: Back up, now: sense of self to the fore in careers and life

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Market Wrap
item.title: Market wrap; all the leasing and sales activity in and around Sydney

item.dc:creator: Danny Katz
item.description: The word of the moment, “weird” can be uttered up to 118 times a day according to those of us who count our daily words on a clicker-counter.
item.title: Hmmmm .... these are the words we’ve been using a lot lately

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: The Andrews government ditched a key element of its own pandemic planning by failing to put Victoria’s Chief Health Officer in charge of the state’s emergency response.
item.title: Victoria abandoned pandemic plan by failing to put Sutton in key role

item.dc:creator: Henrietta Cook
item.description: "I’ve been unlucky enough to land a one-in-a-100 year global pandemic during my time as health minister."
item.title: 'I've been unlucky': Health Minister feels the heat

item.dc:creator: Karl Quinn
item.description: Horror has moved from the low-budget margins to the big-budget mainstream, and some people think politics is behind the shift.
item.title: HBO's Lovecraft Country part of a golden age of horror

item.description: John Ward Knox's portrait of New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern was released from Australian customs just in time to be entered into the Archibald Prize.
item.title: What it's like to paint a prime minister's portrait

item.dc:creator: Anna Prytz
item.description: Ninja Warrior courses in the backyard and neighbourhood cross country are just some of the ways school children are reimagining PE in lockdown.
item.title: Feeling kinda sporty: Kids find new ways to stay active in lockdown

item.dc:creator: Josh Dye
item.description: The interactive exhibition has shown in 50 cities worldwide and attracted more than six million visitors.
item.title: Sydney poaches major Van Gogh art exhibition from Melbourne
